691.quoteText: we determine that the access, preservation, or disclosure of your Personal Data is required by law to protect the rights, property, or personal safety of Grammarly and users of our Site, Software, and/or Services, or to respond to lawful requests by public authorities, including national security or law enforcement requests
691.title: No promise to inform about government requests

tosdr.case: This service reserves the right to disclose your personal information without notifying you
tosdr.tldr: Although Grammarly may disclose your personal information in light of a subpoena, or when they believe in good faith that it is necessary to protect their rights or yours, for example, they make no promise to inform users about such a request and/or disclosure.

1022.quoteText: Through the use of cookies, we help deliver advertisements for relevant Grammarly products and services to you. For more details on cookies, please see the “Does Grammarly use cookies?” section below.
1022.title: Grammarly uses third-party cookies and Google to show ads

tosdr.tldr: Grammarly uses Google Analytics and DoubleClick to track your browsing history and in turn provide targeted advertisements. They do, however, mention that you can opt out of Google Analytics for Display Advertisers and customized Google Display Network ads in the Ads Preferences Manager.

1103.quoteText: Grammarly uses cookies and similar technologies, including tracking pixels and web beacons, to collect usage and analytic data that helps us provide our Site, Software, and/or Services to you, as well as to help deliver ads for relevant Grammarly products and services to you when you visit certain pages on the Site and then visit certain third-party sites
1103.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: You are tracked via web beacons, tracking pixels, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting
tosdr.tldr: Grammarly uses third-party cookies to track your preferences and profile information, as well as general usage and volume stats, which don't include personal information. The web beacons are used along with cookies to analyze how their site is used, and to gauge how effective their customer communications and marketing campaigns are. For example, they know how many users access a specific page and which links they clicked on.
